comment.author: 33472394@N00
comment._content: Presumably this is the second Madison Square Garden, which opened in 1890. The colonnade looks similar to the one in the Wikipedia illustration. Unlike the current building with that name, this one was actually close to Madison Square.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Those appear to be political posters, stuck onto the columns with adhesive tape. But had adhesive tape been invented by 1913? And can anyone make out the words -- or recognize the candidate's photo?

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Dendroica cerulea: thank you for the information about Madison Square Garden. We will add some of it to the image description.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: The posters say "FOR CONTROLLER WM. A. PRENDERGAST". William A. Prendergast was controller of the city of New York. See u.o. New-York tribune., October 17, 1909, Image 17 New-York tribune., October 27, 1913, Page 3
